agenda_items.title: Approval of the January 23, 2024, Charter Review Commission Meeting Minutes
agenda_items.description: Approval of the minutes from the previous meeting.

agenda_items.title: Submitted Amendments Recommended for Exclusion
agenda_items.description: Amendments 71, 100, and 112 are recommended for exclusion.

agenda_items.title: Prohibit the creation of jobs exempt from Civil Service
agenda_items.description: Amendment 15 to prohibit the creation of jobs exempt from Civil Service in Chapter XVI.

agenda_items.title: Clarify city council's role in designating managerial personnel
agenda_items.description: Amendments 90 and 107 to clarify that the city council designates which managerial personnel are included within the unclassified service.

agenda_items.title: Amend Chapter XVI §6 regarding reorganizations and reductions in force
agenda_items.description: Amendment 91 to reflect that reorganizations and reductions in force should be treated in the same manner with respect to compensation and reassignment.

agenda_items.title: Clarify the duty of the Human Resources Department
agenda_items.description: Amendment 106 to clarify that it is the duty of the Human Resources Department to establish rules governing the evaluation of conduct and performance.

agenda_items.title: Add requirement for a citywide Bike Plan
agenda_items.description: Amendment 117 to add a requirement for the city to adopt a citywide Bike Plan by ordinance.

agenda_items.title: Authorize administrative approval of plat applications
agenda_items.description: Amendments 99 and 116 to authorize administrative approval of plat applications.

agenda_items.title: Broaden the city’s notification process
agenda_items.description: Amendments 110, 118, 119, and 120 to broaden the city’s notification process to include other media options.

agenda_items.title: Amend special meeting call requirements
agenda_items.description: Amendment 123 to require that special meetings shall be called upon the written request of five members of the city council.

agenda_items.title: Extend deadline for petitioners to collect signatures
agenda_items.description: Amendments 55 and 114 to extend the deadline for petitioners to collect required signatures from 60 days to 120 days.

agenda_items.title: Reduce number of signatures required for referendum
agenda_items.description: Amendments 55 and 115 to reduce the number of signatures required on a petition in support of holding a referendum.

agenda_items.title: Amend vote requirement for council to amend redistricting plan
agenda_items.description: Amendment 93 to amend the vote requirement for council to amend the redistricting commission’s recommended districting plan.

agenda_items.title: Allow residents to serve on various commissions
agenda_items.description: Amendment 94 to allow residents to serve on the redistricting commission, the plan commission, the civil service board, and the park and recreation board.

agenda_items.title: Delete section on urban conservation programs
agenda_items.description: Amendment 86 to delete the section allowing the city council to provide urban conservation, rehabilitation, and redevelopment programs.

agenda_items.title: Amend language regarding City Secretary's assistants
agenda_items.description: Amendment 58 to amend language to provide the City Secretary with assistants and employees.

agenda_items.title: Amend requirement for assistant city attorneys
agenda_items.description: Amendment 56 to delete or amend the requirement that all assistant city attorneys shall devote their entire time to the service of the city.

agenda_items.title: Prohibit the creation of jobs exempt from Civil Service in Chapter XVI
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 15]

agenda_items.title: Amend Chapter III §13(b) to allow each council committee to elect their own chairs and vice chairs
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 122]

agenda_items.title: Require that the mayor receive two councilmember co-sponsors for board and commission chair appointments
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 96]

agenda_items.title: Authorize a limited power of veto for the mayor with a city council override of a two-thirds vote
agenda_items.description: Authorize the mayor to exercise veto power over city council action calling a special election for the purpose of authorizing general obligation bonds, with a city council override of a two-thirds vote. Authorize the mayor to exercise veto power over the annual city budget.

agenda_items.title: Require the city manager to seek and obtain the city council’s policy priorities before submitting the city manager’s annual budget
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 108]

agenda_items.title: Establish an Office of Ombudsman within the function of the city auditor
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 37]

agenda_items.title: Clarify that city council’s appointments to boards and commissions are at-will
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 13]

agenda_items.title: Delete Chapter III §15 prohibiting city council from interfering with appointments or subordinates of city manager
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 9]

agenda_items.title: Require appointees to boards and commissions to reside in the council district of the nominating councilmember
agenda_items.description: while allowing for a 2/3 vote non-district exception. [Amendment 124]

agenda_items.title: Change wording in the charter to be more inclusive
agenda_items.description: using “resident” or “people” in place of citizen. [Amendment 1]

agenda_items.title: Amend the vote requirement for council to modify the redistricting commission’s recommended districting plan
agenda_items.description: from a 3/4 majority vote to a 2/3 majority vote in Chapter IV §5(b)(6). [Amendment 93]

agenda_items.title: Amend Chapter IV §5 to add eligibility criteria for serving on the redistricting commission
agenda_items.description: [Amendment 125]

Public Comments on Items III – VI
Vote to Approve the January 13th, 2025 Special Called Meeting Minutes
Presentation by City of Dallas: Office of Homeless Solutions (OHS), Homeless Outreach & Advocacy
agenda_items.description: The manager for Homeless Outreach, Lisa Rand along with the manager for Homeless Outreach & Advocacy, Barry Dyson will present to the commission on the Office of Homeless Solutions. Specifically, they will address how OHS addresses homeless veterans.

agenda_items.title: Veterans’ Wellbeing Assessment Update
agenda_items.description: Christina da Silva, Assistant Director Office of Equity & Inclusion to provide an update on the status of the Veterans’ Wellbeing Assessment and next steps.

agenda_items.title: Scholarship on Behalf of Dr. Katina Robertson
agenda_items.description: Staff will provide an update regarding the commissions inquiry into establishing a scholarship on behalf of former D3 Commissioner, Dr. Katina Robertson.

agenda_items.title: Letter to City Council in Support of Filling Five (5) Commission Vacancies
agenda_items.description: Staff will provide an update regarding a draft letter to City Council to seek support in filling the five vacancies on the commission.

agenda_items.title: Commissioner Business Cards
agenda_items.description: Commissioners will review and provide feedback between two sample business cards and the information on them. If possible, they will make a decision on which card and the pertinent details. Ultimately, the finalized card will be sent to print.

agenda_items.title: Vote to Approve the January 13th, 2025 Youth Commission (YC) Meeting Minutes
Presentation by City of Dallas: Teens Organized and Prepared for Success briefing
agenda_items.description: The manager for TOPS, Vernon Pellum will present to the commission on the Teens Organized and Prepared for Success Program. They will also address their partnership with the youth commission and how this will support the triple threat basketball game and future events.

agenda_items.title: Presentation by City of Dallas: Welcoming Communities briefing
agenda_items.description: Shpendim Nadzaku, welcoming coordinator, will provide a briefing regarding the City of Dallas WCIA office, their programming, and their response to current events.

agenda_items.title: YC wide retreat update
agenda_items.description: Chair Hawkins will provide an update on the ongoing action and next steps for the Youth Commission wide retreat.

agenda_items.title: Environmental Committee task update
agenda_items.description: Commissioner Moreno will provide an update on the activities of the Environmental Committee, including stream team certifications and earth day activities with Dallas Arboretum.

agenda_items.title: Triple Threat Basketball game update
agenda_items.description: Commissioner Nelson will provide an update on the Triple Threat basketball game including what arrangements have been made and what support will be needed from the commission.

Rules of Courtesy                                                              de diversos intereses e ideologías.  Para asegurar la imparcialidad

varied   interests  and  ideas.    To  insure  fairness  and  orderly          Ayuntamiento, al personal administrativo, personal de los medios

Reglas de Cortesía  



                                                                            ...
agenda_items.description:
Reglas de Cortesía  



                                                                               Las asambleas del Ayuntamiento Municipal reúnen a ciudadanos  

Rules of Courtesy                                                              de diversos intereses e ideologías.  Para asegurar la imparcialidad  



                                                                               y el orden durante las asambleas, el Ayuntamiento ha adoptado  

City   Council    meetings     bring   together    citizens   of   many        ciertas  reglas de cortesía que aplican a todos los miembros del  

varied   interests  and  ideas.    To  insure  fairness  and  orderly          Ayuntamiento, al personal administrativo, personal de los medios

Public Comments on Items III – VI
Vote to Approve the February 13th, 2025 Veteran Affairs Commission Meeting Minutes
Veterans’ Wellbeing Assessment Update
agenda_items.description: Christina da Silva, Assistant Director Office of Equity & Inclusion will provide an update on the status of the Veterans’ Wellbeing Assessment and next steps.

agenda_items.title: Scholarship on Behalf of Dr. Katina Robertson Update
agenda_items.description: Christina da Silva, Assistant Director Office of Equity & Inclusion will provide an update regarding the commissions inquiry into establishing a scholarship on behalf of former D3 Commissioner, Dr. Katina Robertson.

agenda_items.title: Letter to City Council in Support of Filling Four (4) Commission Vacancies Update
agenda_items.description: Christina da Silva, Assistant Director Office of Equity & Inclusion will provide an update regarding a draft letter to City Council to seek support in filling the four vacancies on the commission.

agenda_items.title: Commissioner Business Cards Update
agenda_items.description: Christina da Silva, Assistant Director Office of Equity & Inclusion will provide an update regarding the commission’s business cards.

agenda_items.title: National Medal of Honor Museum Grand Opening Update
agenda_items.description: Christina da Silva, Assistant Director Office of Equity & Inclusion will provide an update regarding the commission’s planned visit to the National Medal of Honor Museum located at 1717 East Randol Mill Road, Suite 301, Arlington, TX 76011. The Grand Opening celebration will be on Saturday, March 22 from 7:00 to 9:00pm.

presenters: Kimberly Knight, MSSW, Director of Caregiver Support Program, Senior Source

Mirka Norman, Supervisor- Community Care Services
Tabitha Taylor, Age-Friendly Officer, Office of Community Care and Empowerment

agenda_items.description: Call to order by the Chair.

agenda_items.description: Public speakers for items V-VII (2 minutes per speaker).

agenda_items.title: Approval of Minutes
agenda_items.description: Approval of minutes for the February 24, 2025 Senior Affairs Commission Meeting.

agenda_items.title: Chair’s Report
agenda_items.description: Reminder of Texas Open Meetings Act Requirements for Videoconference Meeting.

agenda_items.title: New Business: Presentation from Senior Source
agenda_items.description: An Introduction and Overview from Senior Source Caregiver Support Program. This presentation will explore the most pressing support needs of caregivers in our community, new initiatives, cultural factors, and how effective current systems are in addressing caregiver challenges.

agenda_items.title: New Business: Presentation from Parkland Center
agenda_items.description: An Introduction and Overview from Parkland Center for Geriatric Care and Healthy Aging. The presentation will address key health challenges faced by older adults, including preventive measures, caregiver support needs, resource gaps, and the impact of social factors on the healthcare system.

agenda_items.title: Staff Reports/Briefings
agenda_items.description: Presentation by the Office of Community Care and Empowerment (OCCE) Senior Services. OCCE will provide a monthly update on services provided, programs, and contracts targeting the older residents of Dallas.

agenda_items.description: Senior Affairs Commissioners District updates by each Commissioner as needed.

agenda_items.title: Adjournment
agenda_items.description: Adjournment of the meeting.

         submitted to the Chairman for signature.
